region:
To ensure that page content is contained by landmarks, you need to use appropriate HTML5 landmark elements or ARIA roles to structure your content. Landmarks help screen reader users and other assistive technology users to easily navigate and understand the content on the page. Example: Here's a simple webpage structure using HTML5 landmark elements: ```html Example Page

Website Title

  • Home
  • About
  • Contact

Article Title

Article content...

Related Links

  • Link 1
  • Link 2

Copyright © 2021 Example Page

``` In this example, we've used the following landmark elements: - `
`: Represents the header of the page, usually containing the logo, website title, and main navigation. - `
`: Represents a navigation menu. - `
`: Represents the main content of the page. - `
`: Represents a self-contained piece of content, such as a blog post or news article. - `
`: Represents content that is tangentially related to the main content, such as related links or advertisements. - `
`: Represents the footer of the page, usually containing copyright information and other secondary content. By using these landmark elements, we ensure that our page content is contained by landmarks, making it more accessible and easier to navigate for all users.
